trial_identification.studytitle: A brief education program for parents of preschool children at risk for internalising disorders.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Reduction in risk for anxiety among inhibited preschool children following a brief parent education program compared with no intervention.

interventions.interventions: Brief parent education - 6, 90-minute group sessions in total - 5 sessions weekly, then a final one after 1 month break. Total intervention - 9 weeks. Parents learn: In vivo exposure for their child; improved parenting strategies; psychoeducation; cognitive restructuring.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Number of anxiety disorders, assessed via structureed clinical diagnostic interview conducted by clinical psychologist.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: 1-3 weeks before start of intervention, then 12 months, 24 months, and 36 months following intervention.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Extent of behavioural inhibition assessed in two ways: 1) parent reported questionnaires; 2) direct laboratory observation.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: 1-3 weeks before start of intervention, then 12 months, 24 months, and 36 months following intervention.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Maternal report of anxiety symptoms assessed via questionnaire.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: 1-3 weeks before start of intervention, then 12 months, 24 months, and 36 months following intervention.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Child self report of anxiety symptoms

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Score on measure of inhibited behaviour at 1 standard deviation above norm. Demonstration of behavioural inhibition on laboratory observation.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Formal diagnosis of developmental disorder assessed during structured clinical diagnostic interview.

trial_design.concealment: Allocation was made after participant eligibility had been determined. Allocation was made by blindly selecting participant condition from a container.
trial_design.sequence: Selection of condition from a sealed container.

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: Balaclava Road, North Ryde. Sydney NSW. 2109

fundingsource.fundingname: National Health and Medical Research Council (NHMRC)

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The study aimed to reduce the development of internalising disorders such as anxiety and depression by providing a brief education program for parents of preschool aged children who are at increased risk for these problems. Children were selected if they were highly shy and inhibited. Parents either received 6, 90 minute sessions providing information about how to reduce inhibition in their child, or received no intervention. It was expected that the brief intervention would result in reduced inhibition in the short term and hence reductions in anxiety and depression in the longer term.

ethicscommitee.ethicname: Macquarie University Human Research Ethics Committee
